primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God commandeers and transforms human subjects (Paul, the Amish, the congregation) to manifest the life and death of Jesus in the world through the 'obedience of faith'.

tekstueel_bewijs: He was commandeered by the risen Christ
the Lord Jesus Christ knocked him off his horse
That is what God did with Paul

object.identificatie: The Obedience of Faith / Manifestation of Christ's Life
tekstueel_bewijs: to bring about the obedience of faith
so that the life of Jesus may also be manifested in our bodies
the gospel of God which [God] promised beforehand
the transcendent power belongs to God

ontvanger.identificatie: The Nations / The Congregation / The World
tekstueel_bewijs: to bring about the obedience of faith... among all the nations
life in you [who receive the apostolic message]

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Apostles (as earthen vessels)
tekstueel_bewijs: by the power of the Holy Spirit
we have this treasure in earthen vessels
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (initiator) and Helper (Spirit).
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that 'roots' obedience in the DNA.

tekstueel_bewijs: Rebellion against God leads to the death of the soul
American culture prizes everything that is rebellious
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'death of the soul' and the 'power of the enemy' (Saul's camp).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's daily ethical response to the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Prepared People (The Church)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Mundane decisions (reaching out, protesting prejudice, teaching children)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'mundane decisions' are explicitly framed as the 'mind of Christ taking shape'—a result of being 'baptized into Christ'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → The Obedience of Faith in Man

voorbeelden: Staying within boundaries is nerdy (critique of the lack of Devoir)
I long to impart to you these thoughts
knowing that his martyrdom would be life-giving
the transcendent power belongs to God
by the power of the Holy Spirit
the power that overcomes the world

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily grace-oriented. It assumes the human subject lacks the 'Pouvoir' (Power) and must receive it from God to achieve 'Obedience'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Saul's rebellion) to ~S2 (Paul as earthen vessel) to S1 (Obedience through Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Subject-Switch': Christ takes the death (S2) so the life (S1) is manifested in the believer.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; rebellion is linked to the death of the soul and the literal murder of children.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the title suggests a focus on human action ('Obedience'), the actantial structure consistently places God as the Subject who 'commandeers' and 'wins' this obedience. It is theocentric.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the Amish story
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: This young girl’s words carry... the obedience of faith.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the active Subject of transformation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He was commandeered by the risen Christ... He didn’t suit the role.
to show that the transcendent power belongs to God and not to us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Marian Fisher and Paul are used as examples, but they are framed as 'vessels' through which God works, rather than heroes to be imitated by sheer will.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: 'This is God at work.'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the burden of 'power' is shifted to God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification; God produces the fruit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Fundamental Program' (Paul's calling) to the 'Secondary Program' (daily ethics) is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Obedience' (which sounds like Law) and 'Power' (which is Grace).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: She offered herself in the place of others... an almost exact parallel to the death of Christ in our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is 'breathing threats and murder' and 'death of the soul'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject. Even when discussing 'Obedience', it is framed as a gift/power received.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this; it is the antidote to moralism.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'mundane decisions' list doesn't slide into a new 'Devoir' (Law) without the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in preaching grace through the lens of obedience without falling into legalism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this uses 'Obedience' (Law-language), but semiotically, God is the Subject (Grace-structure).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 1; semiotics shows how the 'earthen vessel' metaphor functions as a modal helper.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the Amish girl is not the Subject of her own sacrifice, but an 'actant' through whom the primary Subject (Christ) acts.

appendices.notities: Analysis confirms Rutledge's influence on the preacher's grammar.
